result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Curtis Barbano

records.addlTxt: Email sent to ACJ advising def has court on Nov 17;  ka

2:02 PM Defendant Nicholas Curtis Barbano appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney Marcus M Zimmer in court for Nicholas Curtis Barbano.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.   Atty, ready for prelim.  State calls Lt. Scott Morland as a witness, sworn in, State questions.  Def waives right to personal appearance, court accepts.  Cross exam from Atty.  No re-direct.  State has filed proposed exhibit #1, admitted, clerk brings in exhibit and sends to Judge to review.  Court finds there is PC that a felony was committed, case is bound over.  State filed information that contains same charges.  Atty, def Pleads NG on all 7 counts, noted.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Email sent to ACJ advising advising def has court on Oct 4;  ka

1:05 pm Defendant Nicholas Curtis Barbano appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney Marcus M Zimmer appeared by video for Nicholas Curtis Barbano.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty, waives reading, def stands mute and requesting prelim hearing, request within time limits.  Motion being addressed.  State comments, def failed to sign both bonds initially, opposes.  Atty comments on motion, seeking clarification.  Court, bond will remain as it is, if release no contact with victim.  NC does not apply will incarcerated.  State notes that def is the one to initiate contact clarification to the court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Email sent to ACJ advising def has court on Sept 20;  ka

2:45 PM - Defendant Nicholas Curtis Barbano appeared by video (fr ACJ).  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. SPD rpt states still unable to find atty for def.  Mo for modif of bond filed by def, req N/C cond amend'd, in jail on revocation.  St opposes modif of bond, but adv's Vic does req No abusive cont - Ct denies mo to modify bond.  Ct adj's case to give SPD more time to find atty for def.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
OSPD Apptmt of Counsel Rpt
Initial appearance on August 30, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Minutes Scanned

REFUSED TO SIGN 7/15/22 PER J631
With $150 Cash bond. 
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
Def to have NO Contact w/ T.C. or Residence can go back one time with police to get belongings.
